poem:
Title: "To the Uninvading Tourist" 

Steel not upon our hushed, half-mile long roads,
Where beauty leans on quiet's tranquil bough;
Nor seek, through footprints, to stifle nature's code
Or ruin the calm with camera-clicks, now.

Let the north-east in peace, its own mystery decode,
As it has done for the hidden stars till now.
Rest our idle fields, untouched by tires' load,
In sacred silence, God's dialect allow.
